author: eggnog _

text: This game was like a museum, you could see a lot of pretty glimering things, but you couldn't touch or interact with any of them. When I think of this game, I think of FF13, only that they replaced their hallways with larger backyards, but is essentially the same thing, run from point A to point B, with no interaction except monsters. Oh and the boring grinding and awful sidequests, sweet jesus.
author: Lion heart

text: what more interaction were you expecting? a lot of JRPGs do this. Hell, even Dragon Age Inquisition was very guilty of this.
author: Noz
Lion heart

text: @Lion heart I mentioned dragon age because not even WRPGs are exempt from this. This is less me disagreeing with you and more of me asking you a question. You'd know that if you took the time to read my question
author: Noz

text: Couldnt touch or interact? Just what are you trying to interact with? You got trees, some swamps, and some glowing shit in this area. Thats it. You can swim around if you need to or talk to Nopon merchants. What else could you imagine doing?
author: Noz
Lion heart

text:
+Lion heart  I remember getting a LOT of experience when exploring, especially when finding secret areas. I have never seen more interaction with the environment in a game. A great example are the high entia shrines that are scattered throughout Bionis that give you great rewards. Or even the 4 beacons you had to activate in Agniratha.
I understand what you're trying to say. But it had to feel like you were actually walking on a titan, that was the purpose of the games huge map.
I have to give you credit on the sidequests though. The collection and hunting quests were annoying, but there were some pretty interesting quests from named NPCs.
author: Robbe D'Hondt

text:
@Robbe D'Hondt Let me put it into different words. I was expecting Xenogears and I got an offline MMO.

I don't know if Takahashi and Soraya had help when they created their masterpiece, but I'm sure as hell they either lost their touch, or no longer work with the people that made their previous masterpiece what it was.
author: Lion heart

text:
+Lion heart  Ah yes, expectations. Always dangerous to have those :p I'm glad I didn't expect the new xenoblade to be like the old one or I would've been very disappointed.
And sorry, but I have never played xenogears.
author: Robbe D'Hondt

text: @Robbe D'Hondt I know you haven't played xenogears, I can tell. Perhaps these new jrpgs are only meant for newer generations.
author: Lion heart

text:
+Lion heart  The depth of the story was what really counted for me in Xenoblade though. The huge maps were just fulfilling an old children's dream of mine.
I do however also enjoy a lot of old RPGs, for instance Golden Sun (played the second one like 3 full times) or DBZ: Legacy of Goku 2 (my favorite) or others. Old school RPGs on the gameboy are my favourite :D
Because of all the good reviews I heard about Xenogears, I'll be sure to check it out if I have the time. Any good playthroughs you recommend?
author: Robbe D'Hondt

text: @Robbe D'Hondt the only good playthrough is the one you make by yourself. Sorry bro. I don't enjoy let's play's.
author: Lion heart

text: +Lion heart  I only do for games that aren't available for me. No problem though, I fully understand. I'll just get myself some random videos then :p
author: Robbe D'Hondt

text:
@Robbe D'Hondt if you really want to play it, but don't want to spend the money on a playstation 1 or 3, and you don't like piracy, then simply buy it on PSN, creating an account on PSN is free. The game should be about 10 bucks. Then, download the ISO on the internet and play it using an emulator. You would be playing it legally since you paid for it on PSN.

A piece of advice on Xenogears though: although the story is the best I've seen on any JRPG, the gameplay and pacing of the game are not really the best. Keeping this in mind you might just enjoy it better on youtube after all.
author: Lion heart

text: +Lion heart  I'll certainly check it out when I'm done with Xenoblade X. Thanks!
author: Robbe D'Hondt

text: +Lion heart I played xenogears and I like xenoblade like 1000 times more. Btw how are the sidequests awful,they're way better then your average sidequests.
author: Nathan

text: +msslamajama2 Xenoblade chronicles is also my favourite game ever in terms of gameplay. I don't want to sound like a fanboy, but I don't think the game has any major flaws. The combat system is my favourite combat system in any rpg. It really comes down to preference.
author: Nathan

text: @msslamajama2 You're telling me that you think XB Chronicles has a better story than Xenogears?
author: Lion heart

text: @Lion heart well I haven't played through it entirely, but I like the characters in xenoblade way more. The story is better in xenogears, but not THAT much better. And characters are more important to me then story. And I prefer it in every other category by far
author: Nathan

text: @msslamajama2 ok, cool then.

text: @Lion heart As a person who's favorite game ever is Xenogears (next to Chrono Trigger), Xenoblade Chronicles is one of the most incredible games, not just JRPG's, I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing so please don't act elitist like you're super special and only the new generation can enjoy it. As an old school JRPG fan and veteran, I wholeheartedly disagree on your assessment and opinion. And seriously, you're comparing a JRPG to Fallout? Completely different style of games. text: This is one of the most beautiful areas I've ever seen in a video game. I was stunned when I first saw it and heard the music in great depth. Daytime Satorl Marsh is so lame compared to this! The colors of the night, and this incredible song, are just mesmerizing!
author: Maester Mike

text:
@Maester Mike I couldn't agree with you more.
This literally is the most beautiful thing I've seen in a video game on any system.
author: stufaman

text:
+Maester Mike 

I'd always skip the day back to night, just for this environment.
author: solitonmedic

text: @solitonmedic Precisely what I did.
author: stufaman

text: +Maester Mike Honestly, I think that's what makes Satorl Marsh so mesmerizing.  During the day, it's this bland, colorless wetland with dull music playing in the background.  But at night, suddenly everything lights up, the music becomes really ethereal, and it's almost as if you're transported to somewhere else entirely.  It gives it this incredibly surreal quality.
author: Giygas_95

text:
@Giygas_95 I'll never forget when I first saw it turn night.
I just froze. Very few games have come close to that reaction since.
author: stufaman

text: +stufaman I wish I had experienced that on the big screen first, but I played it on 3DS first.  Still really mesmerizing though.  Also, it was already night when I got there so I didn't really get that reaction as much.
author: Giygas_95

text:
@Giygas_95 I kinda feel bad about that now, sorry.
But you're trying to imagine how that was, just goes to show the impact this game can have.

I could imagine you forgot you was playing on a 3DS when you saw that?

I know I had that when I played Zelda on the original Gameboy, oh so long ago, lol.

text: Funny, I've literally just finished Nier for the first time XD I'd recommend going for Xenoblade as the story progresses a LOT faster. Not to say Nier is a bad game though. Once you understand the story it becomes one of the most rewarding games I've played. Think of it as a lengthy shadow of the colossus.

text: Go for Xenoblade Chronicles. The music, characters, and storytelling are all excellent and hearken back to many of the great qualities of the golden era of RPGs. One of the best RPGs I've played in the past ten years, along with Lost Odyssey and Radiant Historia.
author: skaman8348

text: My absolute favorite track from the entire game. And that's saying a lot since the entire soundtrack was excellent from start to finish. Satorl Marsh at night, however, is such a beautifully haunting melody that easily thrusts itself to the top of many lists.
